metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39537 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in ncurses through v6.2-1. _nc_captoinfo in captoinfo.c has a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
lib32ncursesw5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
lib32tinfo5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
lib64ncurses5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
lib64tinfo5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libncurses5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libncursesw5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libtinfo5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libx32ncurses5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libx32ncursesw5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
libx32tinfo5 - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
ncurses-base - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
ncurses-bin - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
ncurses-examples - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
ncurses-term - 5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> read of size 1, DoS only

criterions.comment: ncurses package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9+20140118-1ubuntu1+esm2').
